attributes.action: introduce a motion of no confidence in the Speaker before the house of commons
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
the speaker has today made a statement to the house of commons stating
 
"And I say again, we all bear a heavy responsibility for the terrible damage to the reputation of this House. We must do everything we possibly can to regain the trust and confidence of the people".

The speaker and those for whom he is responsible have been intimately involved in the administration of MP's expenses and the attempts to hide the revelations contained in the Daily Telegraph from coming to light>

As such, he bears full "responsibility for the terrible damage to the reputation of " the House of Commons and should resign forthwith

rejection.details: Speaker Michael Martin announced on May 19 he will step down in June.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
